intro: Guarea mangenotiana, commonly known as the mangenot tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, featuring a straight trunk and a broad, rounded canopy. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive veining pattern. The flowers are small, greenish-yellow, and clustered in dense panicles, followed by woody, spherical fruits.
